io
Class TimeSlotReader

java.lang.Object
  io.TimeSlotReader

public class TimeSlotReader
extends java.lang.Object

Reads information related to times and days from a file. Blank lines and lines starting with "%" are ignored. The first line of the file names what to call each day of the week, separated by commas, starting with what to call Monday. The next line is the morning/evening cutoff time, represented as hour * 100 + minutes, where hour is in military time. For the rest of the file, every line should be a combination of days on which classes are offered.

Many methods require that read() be invoked before them and will throw an IllegalStateException otherwise. The idea is to construct an instance, invoke the read method, and then invoke other methods. The read method is not allowed to be invoked a second time. This effectively makes an instance immutable once input is read.

Invariants:
  • none

Version:
May 28, 2011: Class created.
Author:
Jonathan Caddey

Method Detail

parseDayString

public java.util.Collection<Day> parseDayString(java.lang.String the_string)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                java.lang.IllegalStateException
Parses a String and returns the Days represented in that String. The days should not be separated by any characters.

Preconditions:
  • the instance has already read in input
  • the_string != null
  • the_string contains days as encountered from the read() invocation.
Postconditions:
  • none

Parameters:
the_string - a String with days represented as described.
Returns:
the Days contained in the_string.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the_string contains an unrecognized day.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the_string is null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if read has not been invoked.

parseDayString

protected java.util.Collection<Day> parseDayString(java.lang.String the_string,
                                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Day> the_day_map)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   java.lang.NullPointerException
Parses a String and returns the Days represented in that String. The days should not be separated by any characters. The names of the days should be contained in the_day_map.

Preconditions:
  • the_string != null
  • the_day_map has mappings of names to all 7 Days
Postconditions:
  • none

Parameters:
the_string - a String with days represented as described.
the_day_map - a mapping of String names to all 7 Days.
Returns:
the Days contained in the_string.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the_string contains an unrecognized day.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the_string is null or the_day_map is null.

parseTimeString

public Time parseTimeString(java.lang.String the_string)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            java.lang.NullPointerException,
                            java.lang.NumberFormatException
Reads a given String as a Time. The time must be in the form of an integer, where the integer = hours * 100 + minutes, with hours in military time. Beginning and ending whitespace is ignored.

Preconditions:
  • the_string is in the correct format
  • the_string != null
Postconditions:
  • none

Parameters:
the_string - a String in the correct format.
Returns:
the Time represented in the_string.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the_string is null.
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the_string cannot be converted to an integer.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the integer is does not represent a Time.

readDays

protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Day> readDays(java.lang.String the_string)
                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Accepts a String which is composed of the representations of all days of the week, separated by commas, starting with Monday. All days must be present and in order. A mapping of the representations to their appropriate Day object is returned.

Preconditions:
  • the_string is in the format as described.
Postconditions:
  • all 7 days are represented in the returned map

Parameters:
the_string - lists all 7 days of the week, separated by commas, starting with Monday
Returns:
a mapping of the representations of days to their Day objects.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the_string is null, there are not 7 days, or a day is repeated.

read

public void read(java.util.Scanner the_scanner)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 InputFormatException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
Reads the input, as described in the class documentation.

Preconditions:
  • The input to the_scanner must fit the description provided in the class documentation
Postconditions:
  • information is correctly gathered from the input.

Parameters:
the_scanner - can read correctly formatted input.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the_scanner is null.
InputFormatException - if the input of the_scanner does not adhere to the description provided in class documentation.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if input has already been read.

                                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
